summary: The document is a declassified memo from 15 March 1967, related to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details a request to identify 'Comandante Willian', who received pilot training at San Antonio de los Banos Air Base in 1965 and 1966 and may have worked as a Cubana Pilot under the alias Ernesto Castro Moro. The memo was addressed to multiple CIA divisions, including the Chief of Station, JMWAVE, and the Chief of the Western Hemisphere Division, highlighting a coordinated intelligence effort regarding Cuba during the 1960s.
key_findings: The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It contains a request for identification of an individual known as 'Comandante Willian', who had pilot training in Cuba and may have been a Cubana Pilot.
The individual used the alias Ernesto Castro Moro during his time in Cuba.
The memo is directed to several CIA divisions, indicating a coordinated effort in intelligence gathering or operations related to Cuba during the 1960s.
keywords: San Antonio de los Banos Air Base
President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
